column11: Review Text
Very calm & mind relaxing place. We can spend our quality time there without any disturbance. They won‚Äôt charge for vehicle parking that would be advantageous. Good place to visit

column8: Chill Vibes & Cheap Eats at Independence Arcade, Colombo
column11: Independence Arcade in Colombo is a stylish colonial-era building turned into a public shopping and hangout space. It‚Äôs got a chill vibe, perfect for catching up with friends or spending some relaxed time with your parents. One of the best parts is free car parking, which is a rare bonus in the city. The area has a few food stalls offering tasty and affordable eats from snacks to full meals, it‚Äôs a decent place to grab something without breaking the bank. You can find places with decent outdoor seating where you can just hang out and enjoy the vibe, especially in the evenings. That said, it‚Äôs not the best place for families with young kids, as there‚Äôs not much to do in terms of entertainment or activities. It‚Äôs more of a spot for chilling, not exploring or shopping extensively. Overall, it‚Äôs a great casual spot to hang out without spending too much and the calm surroundings and historic architecture add to the charm.

What has happened to Arcade Independence Square? What used to be bustling with young and old walking, running and strolling around, now has become a desolated almost derelict area without soul. Here and there young couples are seated enjoying each other‚Äôs company, other than that the place has become lifeless. There are a few eating stands but when there are no customers, these also lose their charms.

We went to celebrate my friends birthday and we had a terrible experience with the staff some are asking money from me and one guy arrested a table to us to cut the cake and I had to pay him and also I extremely forgot to return the butter knife to restaurant and that manager was blaming me in front of everyone what we thought is we will never come back to this place because they don't have hospitality quality at all this evening spoiled my friends birthday

A colonial period square with huge open space in the surroundings. Arcade mall on one side, a completely colonial style building with a few high end stores, was almost deserted on a Saturday. There were a few families in the independence square who were jogging, exercising, walking and kids were playing. Do visit if you have time, nothing spectacular !

This is arcade / mall is a complete waste of time. If you like shopping for big name fashion you might like it but you can do better at the airport. It would rate a 5 as a place to get out of the rain. There are a lot better places to find something memorable
This old colonial building square is converted to a shopping and food outlets complex. A good place to hangout in the evenings.

column8: Lovely building with a few shops inside
column11: We decided on a day of seeing the Malls and this was on the list. The building is an old asylum and is beautiful and detailed. Not many shops but found a bargain in the sales. There are food place at one end and toilets.
It s a beautiful place for all my lovely travellers arround the main city of colombo.there have more architectural construe.

This place is a refurbished colonial building. Nice place with several branded stores and restaurants. Ideal location for photos and nice place to relax and enjoy your meal. But some of the areas are seems to be neglected now on maintenance and maintenance should be improved in this place. This expands in  a large area and not much crowded.Very large parking area is available. It is not a large type of mall with lot of people and busy atmosphere.There are limited number of stores with branded items.But have a good variety of food stalls & restaurants. Overall nice place to relax and enjoy in the heart of Colombo.
The place in the mid of colombo having great photo locations. Colonial style building. Also contains restaurants to fill your taste buds. Nice place to have a group conversation.

I was looking for a mall but this isn't a mall. It has Burger King, cafes, Gallerie (duty free it seems), Body Shop. I was hoping to a pharmacy or some departmental store so don't go if that is what you're looking for. Plus side... the building is stunning colonial building with white walls and wooden interiors. So beautiful! üòä

Ive visited here several times and I must say that the environment in between the two sectors was really attractive.Much satisfied with all the branded stores in one mall,also we enjoyed ourselves with a movie in the"Empire Complex" which was equipped well with the best facilities.Its actualy a nice place to hang around.

Ashiq & Basith led us straight to the t Lounge by Dilmah Shop No.04 @ the Arcade is such a treat with Mr Fawaz who served us and because he also wanted us to try the Sri Lankan ginger "teh tarik"... he had one made complimentary for my wife :)

The Cinema itself is high quality and nice. However 2 points which need immediate solving. Number 01, the manager there is Rude and his customer service skills are ZERO. Due to the high prices we pay, we highly suggest replacing this manager! Makes the experience there bad, due to that. Number 02, the Air conditioned is too freezing. We cannot watch the movie in comfort.

This is such a unique location to have this beautiful colonial building filled with nice shops and probably the best tea lounge I have experienced so far. Unfortunately, due to the number of high rise buildings being constructed in Colombo, each accompanied of their own shopping complex, this Arcade loses importance. Quite some shops are empty and the ones present are actually pretty expensive. If the building next door could be refurbished the same way, it will make probably one of the most unique places in Colombo to spend an afternoon or evening.

This is a decent mall tough rather deserted. It has one of the better movie experiences in Colombo. The gold class is genuine, with reclining lazy boy seats and on weekends you can order meals from your seat. The food comes from the pub Assylum downstairs. Popcorn and sodas including diet Pepsi are always available though a bit pricy for the quantity. it's clean but toilets are outside. And they are aweful!

Entire shopping complex is in a colonial style building . Apart from the building , it was a very poor shopping experience. There‚Äôs no air conditioning in hallways. And bathroom are located out side the building which you have to pay before use. You may find lot of branded stores there, but entire complex look deserted.

We went to the Arcade looking for a specific shop, which we didn't find. We did go to a Spa there - I had a pedicure my partner had a massage. I got the feeling we were the only people to book a treatment that day. The cafes and eateries at the Arcade were reasonably busy, the fashion shops were deserted. I went to a tea shop - nothing inspiring. The building is beautiful and worth a look. The Arcade needs something to draw people on apart from expensive fashion shops.

Hi Guys If you are wanting to shop in Colombo than Arcade Independence Square is the last place. There is hardly anyone who comes here for shopping. Most of the stores are having a deserted look and absence of big brands is evident. Instead go to Odel.

In search of a nice shopping mall we landed in the Arcade Independence Square. The building looks really nice and the grounds are well kept. Nevertheless, everything seems very empty and somehow careless. Shops like Hugo Boss can be found in the arcade. For us that was unfortunately a complete failure, so we quickly drove away from there.

We visited the square at first for its building that looks like the white house... There was a scout camp, with more than 300 kids and 50 responsible. We ended up playing football with the kids. I wish everyone visiting the square will come across a scout camp!
Nice shops with western brands but not a place to spend hours and hours. We visited because they had a Tommy Hilfiger shop but most of the clothes were for men unfortunately.

Lots of high end shops. I'm pretty sure that the average earner in Sri Lanka does not shop here. The prices were as you would expect in high end stores and even perhaps a little more expensive. The building is certainly worth a walk through as the restoration is beautiful.
Environment is good for a Sunday meet up with friends and a photoshoot. All stuff to buy are bit expensive. Movie theater is too much costly for the comfort. Worth visit .
The location was beautiful and my toddler enjoyed the stroll in the park. The architecture of the building is gorgeous too.
I love going here to admire the building's architecture.  However, the shops are only for the very well off.  There needs to be more variety to appeal to the regular tourist.

Arcade at Independence Square, as the name suggests, is right next to the Independence Square and has a nice old-world charm to it. It's royal, classic and truly amazing architecture will bowl you over. This place has some nice stores to buy a lot of stuff.

We like coming here for the shops. They have cinema and a few nice eateries and a great massage place. But we dread having to use the toilets because they are awful. For a place of this standard and style we cannot believe that nothing ever gets done about the loos. There is never toilet paper, the seats are always wet and the staff look completely unhelpfully on, oblivious to what a well kept restroom would like like.

Excellent ambience combined with 5 star foid and amazing cocktails.  The live music was the icing in the cake.  Fabulous customer care. All the meats were imported from Australia and the organic vegetables and micro herbs based food was divine.  Highly recommended.

Arcade Independence Square is a very good shopping mall with branded shops for shopping, a food court with very good restaurants, and a beautiful natural green area in the complex. The Arcade premises is a large place with a series of connected renovated white colonial buildings. The buildings are surrounded by green lawns, tall trees and paved floors. It‚Äôs situated in the independence square and walking distance from the independence memorial hall. It's indeed one of the loveliest places to hang out in Colombo city.

High end branded shopping complex along with resonable priced food court, Not many options though. As I can remember they have burger king as well. For kids they can see the fish down the glassed tiled pond which we can walk over. Theater in the premises give another advantage to attract people.

Old Colonial building turned to high end shopping district. Not a bad idea after all. All the good brands and companies have their shops in it. I saw a few high end jewelry shop as well. It is just a five minutes walk if one is in the independence memorial hall. It can be seen from the hall itself.

I used to pass this place even before the construction began .Never imagined that this would become a wonderful architecture. Specially at night , view is spectacular along with near by Independence square. A great place to hang out with friends and have a bite. Prices are bit hight but seems fair with the reputed shops who provide them. Even for an official meeting , these days it is a good place . Kind of a unique experience. You have bank atms and well maintained washrooms and a lot of parking space too.
Visited with Family. A place with something for everyone. Really enjoyed food at Kaama Suthra.Kids enjoy the 3d movie at the theater.will visit again.
Nice landscape with branded shops and good restaurants. Good place for tourists. Clean and picture perfect place. Prices are high

Like the setting and the arcade although did not have many shops. Some of the shops sold quality products but were overpriced. The restaurant 'Kema Suthra' was highly overpriced as well. But there is a small food court as you enter the building where one can get snacks, rice and curry and pasta at reasonably good prices. They have a lovely little garden where you can take a stroll or relax.
The building looks way better than how it used to be. However, there's nothing much for a person to do. it's an okay place to take a stroll and maybe have a quick meal

Visited on 14/7 to purchase a wrist watch. Still they are maintaining the standards which I saw on opening days..There are places to eat and to buy quality goods. Place is suitable to up market shoppers. Some shops are reluctant to offer discounts even they do not have business. Ideal place to spend an evening.

A former asylum built in the 1870's this series of buildings was a very sensitive restoration of a historical edifice, turned into a multi use complex from restaurants to shops and spas. Very photogenic at dusk and a stroll away from the Independence Museum and Park. Away from the crowds so a good alternative to spending your late afternoons in Colombo.
Good for a short stroll, but very boring otherwise. Disappointing if shopping is in mind. Shopping scene in Colombo is very sad!

a quick tour would be sufficient.. the building itself is lovingly restored with upmarket boutiques, some luxury shops, restaurant and etc. If only the management can enhance a bit of cultural side instead of more commercialism aspect of the whole premise that incorporate the history explanation of the building or art galleries that Colombo as the capital city lacks of.

Went for a shopping trip and left as soon as possible. When you walk into a store the shop assistants either stay slouched behind the desk and ignore you, or follow you around the store with their arms folded scowling at you until you hastily leave. Not a pleasant experience at all, and really put me off buying anything. Most of the shops were on the expensive side too. Went to the cinema on another occasion. Otherwise comfortable, but you need make sure you bring a jumper or two, or you will freeze to death!!

This is an ancient plus historical place located near to the Victoria park and other popular places in Colombo like Lotus Convention center. Good place for relaxation, walk and enjoy the natural beauty. Though, there are few shops available - not an ideal place for shopping.

I was here on a wednesday at noon. Almost every shop was closed. Maybe its better other times - i don't know. I was disaponted as this is said to be a shoppingmall. But the building is nice but if you mainly come here to shop you might get disapointed.
Bit of an unorganized place with large spacious buildings. poorly coordinated, and staff doesn't know where shops and restaurants are located. High priced products and restaurants.

Went here in December 2016 during our holiday. I'm late in writing this review. This is an old government building renovated nicely and used as a shopping and dining arcade. We went in the evening (after dark) and it seems all shops closed at that time. We actually didn't notice much shops. Not sure whether this place is a good shopping location or not (probably not). Well maintained grounds are excellent for relaxing and brisk walks in the evening. There are few restaurants here but choice is limited. I think this place has more potential than what's it's used for currently. Nothing much to be interesting..

Originally a British asylum now turned into a shopping arcade as well as restaurants. Some are at the high end others are affordable. Plenty of space to walk about and take photos. There is cinema as well.
This place has been open for quite a while now but lately this place has not been maintained well.. hope it will be restored to what it was..

Arcade Independence Square, is one of the top places for shoping in Colombo. It looks like a mansion. It looks new, but was built in 1889 as an lunatic asylum. Arcade Independence is a place where few old buildings were used as Government offices. During the Presidency of President Rajapakse the old buildings were renovated and converted into this wonderful shopping mall. It is just 15-20 minites drive from city center and located adjacent to where Sri Lanka was declared free. It is now the most popular shopping, leisure and entertainment complex in the city. Fashion apparel, sports apparel, watches, electronics, cinema theatre and even a wax museum, are located here. There are over a dozen excellent restaurants. But what really sells this complex are it sheer goodlooks. Everything is white and wood, brightly lit, decorated in colonial themes and utterly inviting. It feels like a villa-turned-shopping complex.
lovely place to relaxing and jogging in the evening. best time to visit this place is evening. has few branded garment shops and food court to spend you day

The premises recently converted to ‚ÄúShopping Arcade‚Äù and named as  ‚ÄúArcade Independence Square‚Äù because it is adjoining to ‚ÄúIndependence Square‚Äù, a national monument in Sri Lanka built for commemoration of the independence of Sri Lanka from the British rule. It is an open-air hall, constructed in 1953. Most of the shops are sold branded items, and much expensive. Price of food also beyond budget traveler. But the place is nice and clean, compare to other places in Colombo. During the renovation it maintained the historical value of colonial ruling.
Great place for shopping .. There are several nice restaurants such as burger- king , asylum etc.. It also has a nice cinama too..

Arcade Independence is a place where few old buildings were used as Government offices. During the Presidency of President Rajapakse the old buildings were renovated and converted into this wonderful shopping mall by then Secretary of Uda Mr Gotabaya Rajapakse. Place has all branded outlets out of which I like most is the Fossil & the Nike outlets If you visit this place  walk on the glass flooring were you could see the pond underneath. Place is very popular among wedding couples to take their photos Has ample parking üÖø space and could enter from two roads.

Empire Cineplex (Independence Arcade) Small cinema (15-20 seats) with very comfortable lounge chairs. Ticket price is very expensive. You can order food and get it to your chair. Air conditioner is so so so so too much and though you ask them to reduce it they don‚Äôt do so. That the only negative point they have

Easily one of Colombo's most ambient and tidiest attractions for your family. Plenty if nice cafes and shops to keep the Mrs happy. Plenty of space for the kids to have a run around , look see . There are 2x fast food joints which kind if devalues the place but that's part of the works we live in. Colonial architecture at its best as a setting and a fine breeze cools through. Cheers !

One of the nicest places in colombo! Must visit for an evening tea or Snacks. We sat at the 'Private Terrace' by Asylum and had a few cups of tea and the prawn gyoza. The tea was okay but I didn't like the prawn gyoza as it was too salty for me.. but my husband really liked it. In general, the ambience is beautiful

This is a spot with a group of fancy brand stores and some restaurants built in a nicely designed mansion-like spot. There are also some water fountains and glass floors, which look nice at nighttime. Going into the air Conditioned stores can be reviving when it is hot and humid. There is a small fruit cocktail place that makes very nice wood apple juice, too bad the arcade is marred with a Burger King. Went into a Dilma tea shop there, excellent variety and prices! If you want a place to hang around late evening or night while in Colombo with nothing exciting planned, this place could work for you.
Nice place.... can enjoy a quiet afternoon with the family,.... shopping, or just relaxing..... Children can enjoy the open space.... The landscaping is beautiful....

The Arcade Independence Square is a shopping complex housed in a group of renovated buildings including the former Jawatta Lunatic Asylum (later known as the Auditor General‚Äôs building) and the former Western Provincial Council Building. It was built as a part of the Independence Square Redevelopment programme initiated by the Sri Lankan Government.Personally I have been coming to Colombo after 37 years as the last time I visited Colombo was in Jan 1979 for 8 days when I was studying Medicine as a student and had come on an excursion from Madras Medical College and had a great time then with my friends.This time had been there with my wife in the first week of December 2016 and really enjoyed visiting this place as some parts of Colombo still remind one of the bygone British Era. Dr.Javed Rasheed

This complex of buildings stands on the site of the original lunatic asylum, and you'd be made not to visit it! It stands directly opposite the Independence Memorial Hall in the Cinnamon Gardens suburb, a highly prestigious and elegant address in the national capital. The Arcade itself is an unusual project in that it was instigated by the former President, Mahinda Rajapaksa, and construction was carried out under the auspices, and finances, of the Ministry of Defence and Urban Development, whose Minister happened to be the President's brother! But the enviable result is a square replete with delightful restaurants, upmarket shopping, skilled craftsmanship in even the smallest details (the street lamps, a pride of lions, the cobblestones, the cool colonnades), and an ambience that oozes quality and pride. It was completed only once peace in the north of the country had been achieved and is a serene addition to the city landscape.

Arcade has one of the top tier shopping experience in Colombo. For him and her, you have a wide variety of stores that offer clothing, electronics etc. For dining, there are different dine-ins that offer various dishes. Near the entrance, glass bottom floor and fishes swimming below - kids love that!

This awesome place was conceptualized and developed by the former Secretary of Defense, Sri Lanka. This is a renovation of a colonial English building which had been used for many different purposes over eras. It has many good restaurants including fine dines a luxurious cineplex, fascinating landscapes, middle level to high end shopping. One of the best places in Colombo to spend the time your leisure with family and friends. The jogging tracks, gym (indoors and outdoors) etc are all free to access.

This former Colonial lunatic asylum has been beautifully restored by the armed services after the war ended. It is now a very peaceful and tranquil location with a decent range of shops and restaurants. This is more upmarket than the popular shopping centres in Colombo but a must for tourists along with the Dutch Hospital and Racecourse Shopping complex.
Have been there several times. Prices may be a bit high but they are all branded shops. And there are a variety of good restaurants.

Could spend your evenings shopping and relaxing whilst absorbing the breathtaking atmosphere at the Arcade Independence Square. Good mix of brands available. Head there in rhe evening since during day tine it could be really hot here. Aircondition is only available inside shops and main areas are non A/c
This colonial building has been beautifully renovated and maintained shops are all air conditioned and contains exclusive brand names that most ordinary westerners can't afford... Worth a look.

If ur a shopaholic of fine brands this is the place to be!. Most of the international brands are there are at a price of course n it is worth the visit!. Please bring in more brands to this shopping haven... Will be back definitely ASAP when we are back in the country!. Can't wait :)))

Located in City Center, Great Architectural building, one of the best place for shopping in Colombo city, lots of international brands are available.  Few options of restaurants are also available. Keema Sutra fine dining restaurant in Arcade independent Square, must try place for Srilankan Cusine.
Wonderful craftsmanship.. The old mental asylum turned into a shopping mall. Love their architecture. Its like walking in a maze..  There's two restaurants and a tea lounge and a cinema..

Independence Arcade is a colonial style structure housing high end brand shops. No sign ages of the brands inside are visible on the outer to maintain the facade look. It's a very clean place and you can shop some international brands like Tommy Hilfiger, Charles & Keith, Fossil to name a few
Arcade Independence Square is very Clean. Very high end shops and restaurants ate available in this area . A relaxing place.

the building does not look like a shopping complex at all. Initially you don't even know where to enter the building. Inside the concept is getting clear: various brand shops are located in the center with a walkway surrounding the building. The place is clean and tidy and welcomes people to go for shopping. You can find clothes, parfumes, electronics and food.

I liked the story of this building. It has interesting architecture and design. Shops were closed (not my taste anyway) or empty when we went (4pm on a Friday). Good for a walk round as an interesting old building.

Colombo does not have many malls & of that standard. that's why arcade is most welcome as a luxury mall. the location/parking .space all within international standards. need more shops & restaurants. definitely a place to unwind in comfort
Upscale mall housed in historic building. Offers a good place for folks to refresh themselves after visiting the neighboring Independence Memorial Hall and Independence Square.
The Shopping is bit pricey .No clear direction which way to go around. Food is good. Nice place to hangout with family.

A very nice place to Chill out, For up market shopping, food joints with international chains such as "Burger King: and many more. There's a Wax museum in this and can enter from Independence Squre side or from Bauddhaloka Mawatha sides. A Place to visit and see to get the real exposure.

This is a shopping center located very close to the independence hall , contains very famous and sign' brand names. There are also restaurants and cafe's.The building been constructed in 18th century and renovated many times today looks very beautiful and new.It is also good to stroll around at nigth.

This is a modern shopping complex in renovated 1800's buildings while preserving their colonial architectural features. There are a number of shopping, restaurants and entertainment options with some open spaces. It is easy to get there, and plenty of parking is available, which is a rarity in Colombo. A must visit in Colombo

Lots of shops , with very  expensive stuff.Its good to have a snack & chill out if you have the time. A well maintained place, good for the younger crowd. Plenty of parking which is a great asset in Colombo.
Excellent ambiance. .so clean and well preserved .loved the restaurant Asylum Restaurant and Lounge Bar located at Independence Arcade Colombo 7. Awesome in every aspect. A must see.

I was really surprised when entering the Mall , and realised that I was almost the only customer there. Of course it was not true. There were lot of people but it didn't feel crowded. Shops are those which you find from each and every mall in the world: Tommy Hilfiger, Apple, Burger King etc. But there is something in this place. Is it history or just architecture - I don't know. Go and see!

Was nice to be taken to this place by homestay host on a mini copper. It was a great place to see, to jog, to walk, to see and eat. THe arcade was built long time ago, i didnt remember clearly but around 14th century. It was like a complex building where you can see, can eat and can go shopping. You will find KFC, Mc Donald around ( walk further behind the arcade to the horse racing course then you can see).
Nice shops and restaurants If you want to buy tea the brand Dilmah ( form the best tea of Sri Lanka) has shop there and also a tea bar where you could taste tea in really incredible ways

This is the newest addition to the Colombo city. They have quite a few of branded shops and some really nice restaurants. There is a couple of movie theaters called Empire ( you can pre book on tickets.lk). If you want to shop for branded cloths, watches, sports clothing, jewelry and stuff this is a really nice option where you can shop in a very relaxed environment. You can have local food, Japanese and even fast food like McDonald's here. There are nice areas where you can sit around and relax.  Most people come for evening walks here where a nice walking trail is located around the independence square nearby. If you are a tourist visiting Colombo and wants to do some shopping you should check it out !

This is a wonderful and a very clean. you can find all the branded shopping centers. It is a great place with many restaurants with great flavours. If you want to have quite time or a fun time with your family it is the beat place for you!
We had a nice walk even though it was bit tiring. But there were lots of crows which was a bit irritating.
Nice concept unfinished when we visited. Retailers still fitting stores and those open had half filled shelves. Not a tourist stop unless you want a burger.

We went there with 5 friends for a discussion as one of our friend suggested this place and we just sat there outside the mall outdoor very relaxing and we were able to finish our discussion and also spent some time around the arcade. It has a movie theatre, shopping mall and restaurants too. We tried the Burger king outlet to grab some burgers. Superb place!

Its hard to classify Arcade as a shopping mall. Formerly an Asylum, the building has been transformed spectacularly adding elegance and a modern touch while retaining the antiquity and feel of a historical site. Arcade houses some of the more high end retail boutiques/stores, a couple of restaurants/food court, and a cineplex. The gardens, surroundings of the building are spectacular, tastefully decorated with brilliant lighting- perhaps the main attraction is a fish tank you can walk on. Ideal place for those who like to take pictures of themselves. A must visit for any tourist. Colombo lacks shopping malls of international standard, while this is by no means a mall, its closest you get to a luxurious, exclusive and premium retail space

An expensive renovation to a run down location; perfectly executed! But, what lacks here; is consumer stores that, really lives upto the standard of this beautiful facility. If, the management could really step it up and attract more consumer brands that could cater the needs of the local consumer; then this place is definitely gunna be one of Colombo's highlights.

This place is in the heart of Colombo, and has several restaurants, a movie theatre, fish pond and high end shops. It is near the Independence square area. The movie theatre (Empire) is an up-market one, with reclining seats and food able to be ordered to your seat. There is also a small food court, and a Burger King here. There is a water feature at the other end as well, featuring some pathetic looking concrete lions that pale in comparison to the majestic ones at the Independence Square just a stone's throw away. Overall, it is a good place to visit to watch a movie, after exercising at Independence Square, or just to kill some time. The shopping consists of some electronic appliance shops, and several high end clothing shops with premium priced products. Only the tea shops are worth looking at. Negative points: This arcade was designed strictly form over function -  you have to walk a very long distance to the toilets, which are not part of the main building so if it is raining, you will get properly soaked. If you need to use the toilet during the interval of a movie, be prepared to run if you do not want to miss the movie starting again! The place is also not disabled friendly, with a lot of stairs to be navigated.
Beautiful building but absolutely empty and boring. The variety of shops was limited and their range of goods outdated.. The stars is for the beautiful building

Not being a place for shopping spree, the venue's far so good for photosnapping, strolling for evening breeze.  I personally like a little teashop at G floor the small front bldg and the dilmah tea room at G floor the main bldg.
Went quite late.. And the lighting made the place look so beautiful. Can be seen. But not extraordinary.

This shopping arcade consists of beautiful old buildings, well-restored, recently. It is a big, posh shopping area by Colombo standards, with eateries. It is very neatly maintained. The day I went there (a week-day evening), it was quiet and not crowded. Worth a visit, if you have a spare evening in Colombo and like old restored buildings.

One of the best works of restoration carried out by local authorities- although one wonders about where the benefits went. Great place to hang out and super atmosphere and a reasonable choice of places to eat. However, found that many times the take away outlets poorly stocked or running out. Places to sit and eat too could be increased. If its shopping you are looking at unless you want to burn a hole in your wallet - not my choice!

One of the finest work done by the previous government. So many advertisements were shot since the opening of this place. If you're looking at the brand, this is ideal. There're fine dining restaurants, cinemas, shopping options for clothing and many more. The outside as well as the inside are well-designed and maintained. You can proudly bring your foreign friends here for a day or night out.

Lovely location and surrounding yet shopping is not for all.... There are a variety of outlets for food , < fine dining and quick bites > the place does get quite crowded on Friday evenings and weekends but weekdays are the best for those who prefer privacy, quiet atmosphere. Arcade does have a 3D cinema as well. but food not available all the time at the cinema and they don't food brought from outside as well. cinema rates are much expensive compared to all cinemas in Colombo so for those who visit the cinema i'd recommend majestic city with much more space and facilities with same movies of course. so in nutshell ; Shopping not the best place Food - I'd say go give it a try they've got a vast variety 3D Cinema - less crowed , more more comfort yet most expensive in Colombo

I was totally disappointed with this place.  It was like a ghost town - empty.  I have no idea why everyone is raving about this place.  When we went there on a Friday night there was absolutely no one expect for a spattering of people.  There is nothing to see expect some neon lights and stores and restaurants empty of customers.

After the renovations done by the SL Army and Urban Development Authority, Arcade Independence Square is a great gift to the nation. Two old government owned buildings fully renovated and gave a new appearance as a perfect business and hangout place in the heart of Colombo city. It was opened year before. Arcade Independence Square is a shopping complex with a mini cinema (I was never had the cinema experience yet). It has a large area for just sit and relax and I recommend it for some business meetings too. You cannot do any activities inside the premises. In the Arcade Independence Square premises, Photography is allowed. There are many wedding couples who are taking pictures and the modernize location is really suiting for those kind of needs. There are many shops but the price is quite high as Sri Lankan economy. There are many food outlets and the quality of food is really good. The restrooms (washrooms) are located in the building which is bit far from main buildings and that is the only bad thing I found out. The parking area is really really big and at any time you can find a parking slot. Finally, Arcade Independence Square is a quality place to spend some time. All are welcome... :-)
very nice shopping area, you can shop branded products. very nicely maintain. very huge shopping arcade
something new classy we could be proud of. nice place to hang out but expensive. nice atmosphere in the middle of busy colombo streets.
An old building restored. Turned out teally nice... This one is now a shopping and dining destination. Really good place to relax and just hang out with friends... Will be back for sure. Manuel.

Beautifully restored fabulous building retaining its former character now that it has been turned into a shopping arcade with shops, restaurants and cinema. The shops here are high end and mostly expensive thus there seems to be more window shopping going on. It's a veritable maze of designer and artisan outlet and has a very good restaurant which always seems busy. There is no A/C but you can rest up and take refreshment at a table in the courtyard and people watch. Beware of the over officious security guy however as he seems a bit over zealous and unnecessary.

This is a really great place to have fun walking,chatting...oh... i really love walking on the fish tank...or something that has got fish in it and u can walk on. The eating stuff is a bit expensive but really awesome. And the shops are fantastic plus u find them a bit westernized than the other parts of the country. It has a great and majestic view at night and the cinema is gorgeous. Never visit it on poya days cause the cinema is shut and i had to bear that myself cause i did that mistake. Try it and u all are gonna love it.

I liked Arcade Independence Square. It has a number of different shops full of brands and a cinema. It's great for window shopping and although a lot of the items are pricey you do find some hidden gems. I was able to find a lot in the sale and even some items that were not were cheaper than prices in the UK. Even if you are not there to buy it is a nice place to walk around with Independence Square behind it. I do recommend seeing the Arcade but it would not be my top choice of shopping with a budget at all.

Refurbished by the previous government and one of the main attraction points in Colombo. The environment and the building is maintained very well and has a scenic view which made a hot place for wedding couples to do their wedding photography as well. Has a lot of shops with world famous branded items, mostly the ones under softlogic holdings. The clothing and accessories are expensive due to their brand name, so if you're into branded items and if you got money it's the best place to do some shopping. Then again it doesn't mean you can't enjoy some window shopping. The food court and burger kind has food items for a lower price, but other restaurants are for mostly fine dining.
Very nice location near the Independence Square (tourist attraction) with 50 m away. Well maintained location with Branded product stores, quality restaurants and a clean & budget food court.

I found this in one of the tourist publications and it sounded interesting.  I was disappointed.  Apart from a pleasant lunch in the tea-rooms there, this is full of western shops and is expensive. The renovated buildings are quite beautiful and the place has potential but apart from the architecture, these shopd could be located in any modern western city.  It needs more genuine Sri Lankan stores and products to make it appealing and interesting to tourists and travellers.

Yes it has some political value. One of the most well maintained places of Colombo. Good for hanging around in the afternoons also. But the shopping is very expensive. The tea Gallery by Dalmah is a must visit.
Beautiful please to see at night To see how this place is converted into a shopping mall Liked it a lot Very friendly place
Lovely building.  We arrived about 10.30am. Many of the shops were not open.  Those that were were more expensive than AU prices.  We went to a 3D movies which was a good way to fill in some time.

Went their couple of times with family, nicely developed building complex and well-maintained garden, couple of good shops  to eat , but when eating out side there is no shade from rain or sunlight and have to cautions from the  crows hanging around Cinema complex is also good ,but very pricy compared to other cinema halls in Colombo

The Arcade next to the Independence Square is an old asylum from the era of the British that has been renovated. With lovely gardens and plenty of walking space, it has a grandiose architecture that is a must see for people visiting Colombo. The shops located inside are geared to sell expensive brands though the food options available have nothing to complain about with a couple of very good restaurants making the Arcade their home. The other very interesting thing here is that the Arcade is a very good visit for the Ingress players out there.

The Arcade Independence Square is located near the well known Independence Square in heart of Colombo 07 Sri Lanka. An old colonial building now been reconstructed and converted to a place where people can do shopping and spend the evenings. Have lots of Restaurants (yet expensive) and shops with genuine Banded goods (yes of course expensive :) ) However you can find a Burger Kings inside and a food court with many affordable restaurants as well. Very nice place to be at the evening and to gather with families and friends since it has outdoor seating facilities as well. Ample parking space is also available. Landscaping and the building is very well maintained. A must visit place.

This is an old colonial building, restored and converted to a shopping and dining destination. Most of the shops are of high end brands and hence expensive. Good place to walk around and spend some time.  Close to the Independence sqaure.
There are ramps only to one section. The other part is completely inaccessible to a wheelchair user. Shops and restaurants are completely inaccessible to persons with disabilities and older persons.
The atmosphere is very good to be there in the evening. Shops there are a bit expensive. But, the feeling you get wandering around the place is invaluable.

They have converted an old Auditor General‚Äôs Building into a Entertainment Destination. They have managed to retain the old charm also. Good collection of restaurants. The highlight in my opinion is the Dilmah Tea Lounge and the Sri Lanka restaurant - 'Kaema Sutra'

had an amazing time, just like the malls in the west, this place is a wonderful shopping experience without the busy crowdy situations that we usually encounter in this part of the world. serene atmosphere, leisurely time, well spread buildings with lots of lung space around. to add to it all, there is even a small aquarium in the walking areas !!.  also some awesome yummy food outlets
A good place to hangaround walk. There are a good choice of food outlets.Food court and restaurants.In the city.
A well maintained  & Very clean place but not enough shops, even to window shop. The best is the good car park. The shops are mostly for Foreign  tourists.

This is a beautiful mall built in a restored old mansion in Colombo. The buildings have been beautifully restored. The stores are nice to browse through, you can even get a bite to eat. The giant fish tank under the floor covered by glass which we can walk on is really cool ! Nice place to bring the family to see!

a nice place to hangout. been here thrice. they've got a lot of branded shops with a lot of variety. The architecture is pretty good. there is a food court with franchise like paan paan etc. and there is also a burger king outlet here. good overall.

I have been to this place for a couple of times. In general it's a good place in Colombo to relax and dine where as shopping is rather expensive here. The food court has a several options for mid range prices including bakery products, rice, fresh juice and ice creams. The Lions sculpture is attractive but the garden would need more plantation of trees since it's very sunny and hot during the day time. Most of the people find the pool with a glass top attractive where you can walk on top of it. The rest rooms seem to be clean and well maintained too. Overall, a good place to spend your evenings.

A few decent shops. Nice looking building. Hard to navigate around the place, but the staff at every store are so helpful and their English is great. No one tried to force a sale or bother you. Found a real nice coffee place. Can't remember the name, but you'll find it! Nice park right next to it.

Its a beautiful Square with lots of shops and a few restaurants around. There are branded stores and also some nice boutiques on the first floor. The famous Kaema Sutra restaurant is located in this square. There are some food stalls where the stores end, where you can pick up some quick eats, along with some South Indian food like Idlis, Vadas and Dosa. The place seems very popular among the locals as well, as it seems to be the place for marriage photo shoots taking place. Each time that we went there, we saw couples in their marriage finery, posing for photographs, in the compound.
Found it by accident. Beautiful building, only that is worth the visit! Apart from that, there a lot of shops inside to discover, aso a small food mal, were we had a tasty lunch.

This is one of the 'top' places to shop in Colombo and one can spend considerable time here browsing around named brands of clothing and other goods. The place has been very well developed and is chic and elegant. Aside from shopping there is a good range of dining options and outdoor opportunities that can incorporate a stroll to the independence memorial displays. One gets a feel of Colombo as a vibrant, modern city here and it is a great tribute to the rapid development seen on the island.
Just beautiful. Well kept grounds.  The restaurants are very good.  The shops are worth a visit.  Night tour is highly recommendable.

This place is good for anyone to breath in a good space, or to exercise around the lush green in the city center , or ride a bicycle along the cycle track, or just relax on a bench looking the water fountains. Even more to shop the branded stuff or dine in a restaurant.It is worth to go to independence arcade area for all these and also watch the independence square within 1 minute walking distance. Free entrance. Good for family. good time to visit is evening.

Now this is how to shop in style. You've got all the renowned brands in town I would say original stuff for decent price. Ambience is really nice good place to chill with the food court . Plenty parking can visit over and over again

My family and I (including 1 infant and a toddler) really enjoyed the day out at this place. They have a nice aquarium which lights up at night, shops, restaurants and a good court. The nearby Independance memorial area and park is an excellent place to get some exercise while in the heart of the busy city of Colombo
Did not shop here though the shops looked inviting. Building is a masterpiece. Had okay food in their food court since we had to rush to the airport

This place looks stunning. It has shops and restaurants.  We went there to shop as we had already eaten. We found a couple of things at reasonable prices, but found it a bit of a strange layout & not many shops.

Newly restored British Colonial building, housing trendy shops, and restaurants opposite Colombo land mark Independence square. Trendy hang out worth visiting. Shops are expensive . Restaurants - you have a choice from Burger King to upmarket restaurants.
Excellent for walking around but most places here are very expensive and only one affordable fast food restaurant. The cinema is great here but bring a jacket it is cold inside!

This place for all walks of life, for the young and the old alike. This place has been a Lunatic Asylum in the British Era. Before renovation and making into a public recreation place it was occupied by Government Offices. Today you can take a stroll around the place, Sit at a low parapet walls and enjoy the sunset or beauty of the flood lit buildings, have a snack from a takeaway or a dinner at a fast food place, or a proper dinner at a high-end restaurant. (Japanese as well as Sri Lankan food). You can walk on the glass covered fish pond. Read the story of the place at the entrance building. It is a very safe place closely guarded by security in civil attire. Please don't tread upon the immaculately maintained grass spread. There is a mini Cinema also if you want to watch a movie. There are clothes and electronics good shops if you are a shopping addict. There are lot of photo opportunities for the travel photographer with a small camera or through your mobile phone. Professional photographers may have to take permission. Next to the attraction is the Independence square where you can see the recent history painted on the ceiling. Near the Independence square there are walking and cycling tracks if you care to exercise.

Located 15 minutes drive from the center of Colombo city, there are some shops of international brand, but you may get bored with it. My favorite is the 3D movie theater which costs relatively cheap Rs750 per adult, Rs500 per child. There provide titles just newly published by Holywood. Now Penguin of Madagascar and Exodus Gods and Kings is playing. After the movie you can enjoy Burger King and ice cream in Elephant House on the ground floor. Or if you stretch out to the separate building where you will see Sushi restaurant offering authentic sushi with relatively reasonable price.
love the night lights. amaxing pond outside. food is a bit pricey but worth visiting and shopping. the place is full of shopping places and eating places, there is a nice and warm cozy feeling here.

Very beautiful architecture. Classic look and feel when you go inside the building. Looks more beautiful at night time when it's full of lights. Big garden behind this place is good for walking and jogging. Felt very fresh over here.

this undoubtedly is one place that one must take a stroll if having some free time in the afternoon or evening. The carefully restored old auditor generals building is glamorous and beautiful. High end shops, Eateries, Restaurants, Cinema, Appliances shops, Banks, clothing establishments, and some seating available for a visitor to engage, experience, sample. In my view the Burger-king, and the more casual eateries in the front on to entrance from Bauddhaloka Mawatha has food at affordable prices, juice stall, bakery, veggie outlet, so called short eats etc can cost you $2-5 per portion. The more expensive high end restaurant like the Kema Sutra can knock you off budget but an interesting experience as it is run by one of Sri Lanka Lanka's finest chefs along with a world renowned Bollywood  film star partnership,. ample parking but runs out of spaces as it attracts a lot of locals in the evening just sitting and walking around not much shopping, great place for photos, many newly married couples must do photo place by the looks of it, and one more attraction for a short stroll in colombo worth making if you have a little spare time...enjoy...

With out a doubt Colombo looks amazing thesedays. And Arcade is apparently the new hangout place for the young ones. Hens I visited it ;) Few good eating places including the tea room and Burger King. I prefer the place at night with all the lights. It really looks amazing. Lovely place to go for a evening strolle :) Follow my adventures/pictures on Instagram & twitter: @JanakaEkanayake

Been there during the day time and yea must say such a beautifully built place. The architecture and the design of the place is just awe! And there are lots of places to sit and relax, enjoy the surrounding and grab some food. People say it's more beautiful during the night time with lights and all. üòä

This is the latest addition to Colombo Attractions. Very old building complex made by Dutch rulers in Sri Lanka several hundred years ago was renovated and now named as Arcade Independence Square, located in the heart of Colombo very convenient and busy area. The renovations were done in an excellent manner without destroying its ancient looks. Lot of shops, Restaurants, 3D cinema theater and much more available in this arcade. Every  day thousands of people come there to spend the evening, specially kids are enjoying the huge fish tank under the glass floor. A must visit place in Colombo, Sri Lanka

The place is really breathtaking . Modern amnities with an old charm to it. Been to the place a few times. It is spacious and nice. It's a place needed by sri lanka because we do not have much to call places as shoping centres. A movies theater, food stalls, clothing shops open space which is nice. The bad side is no one seems to be interested in shopping. Most of the shops are having srilankan and western designer wear, expensive to the everyday people. The few restaurents are also having dress codes and fancy themes but there is a burgerking and a food court so bingo! A good place to chill and relax sometims feels like a huge emptiness is there.
Its a simple hall marking the independence of sri lanka on 4th Feb 1948. Its simplicity is its plus point. No touristy crowd. No souvenir shops. No blocking view and yes ample of photo opportunity.

it is the the new hip happening place in Colombo. went there few days after the opening and went there few times. it's really a place like you see every where around  the world a shopping complex. the thing is here in Sri Lanka we do not have much places to call as shopping centers so this is a good, new addition to Sri Lanka. overall the place is very well done and feel like you are in  a nice hip place. the old Auditor General‚Äôs Building was trance formed in to this beautiful modern hip place. nice places to eat and to shop pr just to relax. just opposite the Independence square so you know how it got it's name. few things to improve like the restaurants seems quite expensive for the everyday person although you have the food court. shops are having product ever day people can't buy like fcuk   shirt that costs around 10,000 rupees. any how that doesn't stop people form visiting the place.

So, when I was in Colombo, I was hooked to this place called Independence Square Arcade. It was a beautifully restored, nicely designed building. It for sure reflects the city's history. There is a nice restaurant called "Kama Sutra" serving contemporary Sri Lankan cuisine. Will be back for sure. :-) Manuel

The place was recently opened. The renovation and build work is world class. You can hang out and do some shopping for branded stuff and also enjoy a snack or a proper meal. Dilmah Tea boutique and food outlets are my favorite.
Interesting architecture.  Visit made more picturesque by wedding couple posing for photos around the building.

The Arcade Independence Square was being talked up as the place to be, a really awesome spot to hang out and what not! I finally got the chance to check the place out since I was in the vicinity of it. The only thing worth checking out here is the architecture, which is quite something, with the fancy wooden floorboards, the fountains and the likes. However, there's nothing else worth checking out here. Actually, much as I hate to say it, I think Majestic City is better than the Arcade Independence Square, since, at least, at MC, the things being sold in shops aren't exorbitantly priced! Therefore, if you're interested in shopping, this ISN'T the place for you. If you're interested in just chilling out, catching up with friends, this IS the place for you.
Nice place to spend the evening with luxury. Having good restaurant and mini Cinemas. If you shopped in here then it will cost your hand and a leg.
Superb place to eat rest relax and nice place to visit have nice restaurant shopping playing for kids beautiful location to take photos
I feel Arcade is a good place to have a walk and have a relaxing time. Food court is cheap and has good variety of food. The shops are nicely done and it's a good experience

I went with the family and was amazed at the array of shops and the general layout of the building with fountains , lawns and many treasures to discover. The shops were not yet well patronised. The theatre facilities sounded impressive. The restaurants were aplenty. The Asylum restaurant and the many artefacts in corridors lent its own charm to this unique attraction.  Parking could be a deterrent and an irritation. Yu could take a walk in the adjoining walking tracks and relax browsing through the arcade.
This has been renovated and transformed to World Class recreative place by the UDA.  Lovey place to experiance  in Colombo.

This newly renovated landmark opened in July 2014 and is an absolute must see and a gem. From it's thoughtfully crafted details to lovely assortment of bars, coffee shops, restaurants and boutiques, it looks set to become one of the city's top destinations for locals and visitors alike. What a fantastic find! We had drinks and a snack at Kaema Sutra - highly recommend it for wonderful service and setting.

A major design fault is the toilets are across from the shopping centre outside and it is slippy when raining and you get soaked crossing the courtyard to get to them. Some great shops and we went to the cinema. I had waxing done at The Wax Museum and we are in the food court. Shame there were no table to eat at inside otherwise great day spent here

Great new place in Colombo to while away a few hours. Lots of places to shop and grab something to eat. There is also a cinema if you feel like catching the latest movie. The whole area around the Independence Square has been transformed with this development and it is beautifully landscaped. Nice atmosphere at night time.

This is a group of older buidlings that have been completely restored to house some global brands as well as some of Sri Lanka s local brands. Beautifully decorated and outfitted. Its the brain child of Gothabya the Minister for development to attract tourists to Sri Lanka. There are also a number of restaurants housed in this building. No Tuk Tuks are allowed, so they are trying to make this an exclusive area.  Cabs are welcome though and is only a 10 min ride from the major hotels along Galle Road. Dont miss visiting.  I bought a beautiful silk top for a fraction of the price I would pay in Australia at Aashkii. They also have scarves handbags and dresses.  Enjoy!.
This is a lovely place to vist during the evening. It contains many shops and restaurants as well as a cinema complex. Newly opened and in a lovely colonial style setting.
